td.content: s:pt presents with severe chest pain for about 6 weeks. pt is a 22 yo M. denies any alcohol use o:Height 192 cm, Weight 62 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 18, rales Bil, mild rhonchi, crackles-LL, CTA-LL, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = diffuse tenderness, BS (+), no hepatosplenomegaly, Skin = decreased tugor a:Pneumonia p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to pulmonary disease.

s:patient C/O severe fever, severe cough, severe chest pain and Respiratory. NKDA. patient is a 22 yo white M student. o:Height 191 cm, Weight 59.7 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 15, rales Bil, mild rhonchi, crackles-LL, CTA-LL, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = diffuse tenderness, BS (+), no hepatosplenomegaly, Skin = decreased tugor a:Pneumonia p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered Chest X-Ray.

s:22 yo male student presents w/ c/o 7 weeks h/o mild long standing inability to ride on elevators due to overwhelming fear accompanied by palpitations, diaphoresis and dyspnea and mild feelings of terror in social situations. o:Height 191 cm, Weight 60.2 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 16 a:Anxiety p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed Buspirone - 15 mg /day, and ordered GAD - 7 Assessment Tool.

s:pt presents with severe fever. pt also reports severe chest pain, severe cough, Respiratory. he is a male student aged 23 Ys. he states he has never smoked a cigarette in his life denies any alcohol use o:Height 191 cm, Weight 60.1 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, Sputum culture WBC present with gram positive diplococci, CBC WBC=12000 /mm3,Hgb=14 g/dL, Basic Metabolic Panel BUN=15 mg/dL,creatinine=0.8 mg/dL, rales Bil, mild rhonchi, crackles-LL, CTA-LL, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = diffuse tenderness, BS (+), no hepatosplenomegaly, Skin = decreased tugor a:Pneumonia p:administered amoxicillin-clavulanate - 2 g 2 x day, performed Sputum culture, CBC, Basic Metabolic Panel, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
